column4: running a laptop with 512 ddr2 memory and sata hdd, experiencing lock ups, any known problems with dapper on this type of hardware?
if you're on a laptop, try adding 'noapic nolapic acpi=off' to the boot options
you can add it to the defoptions= line in /boot/grub/menu.lst
np's, that fixes common problems with lockups/slowdown on laptops
at the end of the defoptions= line
yes, it's a line in that file.  add 'noapic nolapic acpi=off' to the end of it, then save and run 'sudo update-grub'
you don't need to add any lines
defoptions= is commented already, and should remain commented.  just type the things I said at the end of it
so long as acpi=off, it should be honouring it
ahh, okay - if it's a poor little laptop, maybe the fans/thermal don't like being on 24-hours? :/
